attributes.action: The U.K. government should offer Thomas Cook a state backed rescue plan.
attributes.background: The U.K. government should reconsider a rescue plan for Thomas Cook and its employees. The government should take an equity stake which would give Thomas Cook breathing space to work out a plan for continued trading. It would give the 9000 UK employees some hope of keeping their jobs.

rejection.details:
Thomas Cook entered into insolvency proceedings and ceased trading on Monday 23 September.

The Government has published advice for customers and employees. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/are-you-a-customer-or-employee-affected-by-thomas-cook

The Secretary of State for Transport made an oral statement in the House of Commons on 26 September. You can read the statement here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/speeches/thomas-cook-update

There's a petition calling for a public inquiry into the collapse of Thomas Cook. You might like to sign this petition.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/274851

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.
